project_abstract.cdata: The primary objective of the Banking Sector Technical Assistance Project is for the central bank of the country to become fully equipped to play a meaningful role in Pakistan's economic development. This project is a follow-on of the ongoing Financial Sector Deepening and Intermediation Project (FSDIP) (report no. 12733). There are six project components. The first component restructures the human resources department, recruits qualified officers, and implements human resources training and a compensation system. The second component supports completion of the automation project as designed under the Information System Strategy Plan formulated under FSDIP; implementation and bramch roll-out of the banking system GLOBUS; integration of all department functions related to financial accounting, human resources, budgeting, payroll, procurement, inventory, and asset management; improvement of the data warehouse; and financing of hardware and networking as well as training and change management initiatives. The third component strengthens and streamlines the national payments system. The fourth component strengthens credit information services. The fifth component controls and prevents money laundering and financial fraud. The sixth component builds the institutional capacity of the banking sector.
